column4: How in the name of the Lord do I make a boot floppy in Ubuntu?
HrdwrBoB; Because the boxen I'm putting it onto has no cd drive, and can't support one, mini itx inside of a large beer can, long story - it HAS to be floppy compatible.
All of the other ones, Red Hat, Mandrake, etc. etc. etc. had boot floppies, is there no way?
debian has one I know, try using that one and altering the /etc/apt/sources.list to fit.
